author: Matthew Kitchen
title: MoviePass’s All-You-Can-See Deal: The Pros and Cons
text:
YOU CAN KEEP your sun-soaked sandy beaches and your ocean-blue Mai Tais. For me, the only true respite from the world is a cold, dark movie theater. As film critic Roger Ebert once grandly declared, the cinema provides a “proscenium for our dreams.” Novelist and film director Stephen Chbosky said that laughing at a movie along with strangers “is living proof that you are not alone.”
Hitting a theater also challenges you to turn off your phone for a few hours, which ain’t nothing.
...
